content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. However, if we both switch our strategies in one of the following two rounds (e.g., I pick B while they pick R), I will end up with a higher total earnings compared to round 1 (as I would earn 35$ and they would earn nothing in that specific round).

4. Given this analysis, it seems beneficial to coordinate our choices in the first round to get the most out of the game's structure. If we both pick R in round 1, we will each get 45$. Therefore, as a human player, I would choose R in round 1 {R}.
